content: Heat the oil. Add 3 tablespoons (39 g) of coconut oil to a large non-stick skillet. Turn the heat to medium-high, and allow the oil to fully melt, which should take approximately 3 minutes. [1] You can also use a cast iron skillet to make the home fries. If you prefer, you can substitute butter or olive oil for the coconut oil. Cook the sweet potatoes for a few minutes. Once the coconut oil is heated, add 1 ½ pounds (675 g) of sweet potatoes that have been chopped into ½-inch (13-mm) cubes to the skillet. Allow the potatoes to cook for 4 minutes. [2] When you add the potatoes to the skillet, stir them in the oil so they are fully coated. Leave them to cook undisturbed after that, though. Mix in the onion and cook the mixture for several minutes. When the sweet potatoes have cooked for a few minutes, mix in 1 large, sliced yellow onion. Stir the mixture well to incorporate the onion, and let it cook for approximately 8 minutes, or until the potatoes and onion are browned. [3] Stir the mixture once or twice while it’s cooking to ensure that potatoes and onions don’t burn. Stir in the seasonings and cook the mixture again for a few minutes. After the sweet potatoes and onions are lightly browned, add 5 cloves of minced garlic, 1 ½ teaspoons (4 g) of chili powder, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of paprika, and 1 teaspoon (5 g) of sea salt. Stir the mixture well, and saute it for 4 minutes. [4] Stir the mixture constantly as it heats to ensure that it cooks evenly. You can adjust the amount of salt in the home fries to suit your taste. Add water and cook the mixture until the potatoes are tender. When the seasonings have cooked with the potato and onion mixture for a few minutes, stir 4 to 6 tablespoons (60 to 90 ml) of water into the skillet. Cover the pan with a lid, and allow the home fries to cook for 4 to 8 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked through. [5] Start by adding just 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of water to the skillet. If it isn’t enough, you can gradually add up to 2 more (30 ml) tablespoons. Transfer to a plate and serve with your favorite breakfast foods. When the sweet potatoes are tender, remove the skillet from the heat. Use a slotted spoon to place the home fries on a platter or individual plates, and serve them with other breakfast foods. [6] The home fries pair well with protein-rich breakfast foods, such as egg dishes, bacon, and sausage. Boil the sweet potatoes until tender. Fill a large saucepan with water, and bring it to a boil on medium-high heat. Place 2 large sweet potatoes that have been peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5-cm) cubes in the pan, and simmer them for 5 to 10 minutes or until they are tender. [7] Add a pinch or two of salt to the water before you bring it to boil to help season the potatoes. Drain the potatoes and dry completely. When the sweet potatoes have finished boiling, pour them into a colander to drain them, and pat them with paper towels to dry them thoroughly. Set them aside for the moment. [8] Heat the oil and add the onions, peppers, and garlic. Add 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil to a large skillet and heat it over medium-high heat for 3 to 5 minutes. Mix in half a chopped red onion, a chopped red bell pepper, ¼ cup (115 g) of chopped green onions, and 2 cloves of chopped garlic, and saute the mixture for 5 to 6 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly golden. [9] You can substitute butter for the olive oil if you prefer. Season the mixture. Once the vegetables are tender, add kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Next, transfer the onion mixture to a medium bowl and set aside for the moment. [10] Cook the drained sweet potatoes until they’re tender. Add the remaining 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of olive oil to the empty skillet. Place the drained sweet potatoes in the pan in a single layer, and cook on medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes, or until they are tender. [11] Stir the potatoes occasionally while they’re heating to ensure that they cook evenly. Raise the heat and cook the potatoes until they’re crisp. Once the sweet potatoes are tender, raise the heat to high. Allow the potatoes to cook for 2 more minutes or until they are golden brown and crisp. [12] Don’t stir the potatoes as they cook. That will help them crisp up on the outside. Stir in the smoked paprika and onion mixture. When the potatoes are crisp and golden, sprinkle 2 teaspoons (4 g) of smoked paprika over them and gently stir in the onion mixture. Mix well until the ingredients are fully blended. [13] If you like, you can also add some chopped parsley to the hash. Serve the hash with your favorite breakfast protein. After you’ve finished mixing the sweet potato hash, remove the pan from the heat. Transfer the hash to a serving platter or individual plates, and pair with your favorite egg or meat breakfast dish. [14] Preheat the oven. To ensure that the oven is hot enough to bake the sweet potatoes, it’s important to preheat it. Set the temperature to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully. [15] Pierce the potatoes and bake them for about an hour. For the breakfast baked potatoes, you’ll need 2 large sweet potatoes. Use a fork to pierce the potatoes several times, and place them on a baking sheet. Set them in the preheated oven, and allow the potatoes to bake for 45 minutes to an hour. [16] You’ll know the sweet potatoes are done when you can easily insert the fork into them without resistance. Cut the sweet potatoes in half and allow them to cool. When the potatoes are finished baking, cut each one in half with a knife. Set them on a plate and allow them to cool for about 5 minutes. [17] The potatoes will be very hot when you remove them from the oven, so be sure to use a potholder or oven mitt to handle them as you cut. Separate the potato flesh from the skin and adding the toppings. When the sweet potatoes are slightly cooled, run a fork between the flesh and the skin to gently separate the two. Next, divide 1 cup (245 g) of vanilla yogurt, a handful of walnuts, 2 tablespoons (20 g) of hemp seeds, and a pinch or two of cinnamon and/or nutmeg between the potatoes to top them. [18] You can also drizzle some honey or agave over the potatoes for added sweetness. You can use any flavor of yogurt that you like on the potatoes and substitute your favorite type of nuts for the walnuts. Feel free to customize the toppings for the baked sweet potatoes to suit your preferences. Maple syrup, almond butter, banana, and diced apple are tasty options. Mix the potato and toppings together and eat. To serve the potatoes, use a fork to mix the potato with the toppings. Add your favorite breakfast protein, such as eggs or bacon, to the dish, and enjoy. [19]

<p>Sweet potatoes make a tasty side dish for a wide variety of meals. If you're only incorporating them for lunch and dinner, though, you're missing out. Whether you prefer eggs, sausage, or bacon, sweet potatoes can make a delicious side for your favorite breakfast meal. Sweet potato home fries have a spicy kick, while sweet potato hash combines the potatoes with peppers and onions for a satisfying breakfast side. For a sweeter option, a baked sweet potato topped with Greek yogurt, nuts, and spices can really hit the spot for your first meal of the day.</p>

<div class="section ingredients sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Ingredients">Ingredients</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="ingredients">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Sweet_Potato_Home_Fries">Sweet Potato Home Fries</span>
</h3>
<ul>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_2653e694d9dbfe48e697d7a865c3a3a3" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_2653e694d9dbfe48e697d7a865c3a3a3" name="item_2653e694d9dbfe48e697d7a865c3a3a3_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">3 tablespoons (39 g) coconut oil</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_9a22ce9bf60938717e7f49b686af3efd" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_9a22ce9bf60938717e7f49b686af3efd" name="item_9a22ce9bf60938717e7f49b686af3efd_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 ½ pounds (675 g) sweet potatoes, chopped into ½-inch (13-mm) cubes</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_5bcb9fabdc808134853fea15578a5f03" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_5bcb9fabdc808134853fea15578a5f03" name="item_5bcb9fabdc808134853fea15578a5f03_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 large yellow onion, sliced</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_92d57d8009a28b98523f4b4f607b91d0" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_92d57d8009a28b98523f4b4f607b91d0" name="item_92d57d8009a28b98523f4b4f607b91d0_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">5 garlic cloves, minced</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_b66284a76643d5f948ea7dc46552a00d" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_b66284a76643d5f948ea7dc46552a00d" name="item_b66284a76643d5f948ea7dc46552a00d_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 ½ teaspoons (4 g) chili powder</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_b2e37e9e75056de0e06c1897d30bde6d" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_b2e37e9e75056de0e06c1897d30bde6d" name="item_b2e37e9e75056de0e06c1897d30bde6d_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 teaspoon (2 g) paprika</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_399c4f1dfb8bcb8b7e0f9c6d9260fb8e" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_399c4f1dfb8bcb8b7e0f9c6d9260fb8e" name="item_399c4f1dfb8bcb8b7e0f9c6d9260fb8e_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 teaspoon (5 g) sea salt, to taste</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_ea86219eabd412f537555ef4bd87f691" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_ea86219eabd412f537555ef4bd87f691" name="item_ea86219eabd412f537555ef4bd87f691_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">4 to 6 tablespoons (60 to 90 ml) water</div>
</li>
</ul>
<h3>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Sweet_Potato_Hash">Sweet Potato Hash</span>
</h3>
<ul>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_332c2eacfbd44ed220a0a4d1b94cf94f" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_332c2eacfbd44ed220a0a4d1b94cf94f" name="item_332c2eacfbd44ed220a0a4d1b94cf94f_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5-cm) cubes</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_8e2f1ec5c947bf90d921a12ee132879c" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_8e2f1ec5c947bf90d921a12ee132879c" name="item_8e2f1ec5c947bf90d921a12ee132879c_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">6 tablespoons (90 ml) olive oil</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_1891d340fdb7dee2c15bcdfd25e706dc" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_1891d340fdb7dee2c15bcdfd25e706dc" name="item_1891d340fdb7dee2c15bcdfd25e706dc_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">½ red onion, chopped</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_c982703e914b3cbe6214d4133cc73505" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_c982703e914b3cbe6214d4133cc73505" name="item_c982703e914b3cbe6214d4133cc73505_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 red bell pepper, chopped</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_782f62a5daeec622b68f9357fb180577" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_782f62a5daeec622b68f9357fb180577" name="item_782f62a5daeec622b68f9357fb180577_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">¼ cup (115 g) green onions</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_83490d544e663e290c35e9bce4af9dfb" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_83490d544e663e290c35e9bce4af9dfb" name="item_83490d544e663e290c35e9bce4af9dfb_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">2 cloves garlic, chopped</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_1892c55677fc13c902b49d15f7ea69ed" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_1892c55677fc13c902b49d15f7ea69ed" name="item_1892c55677fc13c902b49d15f7ea69ed_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">2 teaspoons (4 g) smoked paprika</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_55fa0ba0a9228cd0a90a5768a256beee" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_55fa0ba0a9228cd0a90a5768a256beee" name="item_55fa0ba0a9228cd0a90a5768a256beee_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste</div>
</li>
</ul>
<h3>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Breakfast_Baked_Sweet_Potatoes">Breakfast Baked Sweet Potatoes</span>
</h3>
<ul>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_1ed7be0d56adac5e2d9b56fe3f3ff632" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_1ed7be0d56adac5e2d9b56fe3f3ff632" name="item_1ed7be0d56adac5e2d9b56fe3f3ff632_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">2 sweet potatoes</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_ecc4dd42080146bd4e8db2f06051e2ef" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_ecc4dd42080146bd4e8db2f06051e2ef" name="item_ecc4dd42080146bd4e8db2f06051e2ef_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">1 cup (245 g) vanilla yogurt</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_0074b9bd05a602017a8007c574b8eaa3" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_0074b9bd05a602017a8007c574b8eaa3" name="item_0074b9bd05a602017a8007c574b8eaa3_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">Handful of walnuts</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_60f381617789b06aa4298d5b83b217c7" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_60f381617789b06aa4298d5b83b217c7" name="item_60f381617789b06aa4298d5b83b217c7_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">2 tablespoons (20 g) hemp seeds</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_a7e0a8ccf1b885ffa88500326135635c" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_a7e0a8ccf1b885ffa88500326135635c" name="item_a7e0a8ccf1b885ffa88500326135635c_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">Pinch of cinnamon and/or nutmeg</div>
</li>
<li><input class="css-checkbox" id="item_c76d1d07716024df81010c0dd537d48f" type="checkbox"/><label class="css-checkbox-label" for="item_c76d1d07716024df81010c0dd537d48f" name="item_c76d1d07716024df81010c0dd537d48f_lbl"></label><div class="checkbox-text">Honey or agave, to taste (optional)</div>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Preparing_Sweet_Potato_Homes_Fries_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Preparing_Sweet_Potato_Homes_Fries">Preparing Sweet Potato Homes Fries</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-1.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-1.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-1.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-1.jpg" height="557" id="img_9a61d05480" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9a61d05480')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-1.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-1.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Heat the oil.</b> Add 3 tablespoons (39 g) of coconut oil to a large non-stick skillet. Turn the heat to medium-high, and allow the oil to fully melt, which should take approximately 3 minutes.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You can also use a cast iron skillet to make the home fries.</li>
<li>If you prefer, you can substitute butter or olive oil for the coconut oil.</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dd/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-2.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-2.jpg" height="557" id="img_a1ec655c01" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a1ec655c01')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dd/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-2.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Cook the sweet potatoes for a few minutes.</b> Once the coconut oil is heated, add 1 ½ pounds (675 g) of sweet potatoes that have been chopped into ½-inch (13-mm) cubes to the skillet. Allow the potatoes to cook for 4 minutes.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>When you add the potatoes to the skillet, stir them in the oil so they are fully coated. Leave them to cook undisturbed after that, though.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-3.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-3.jpg" height="557" id="img_aace75bee0" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_aace75bee0')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-3.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Mix in the onion and cook the mixture for several minutes.</b> When the sweet potatoes have cooked for a few minutes, mix in 1 large, sliced yellow onion. Stir the mixture well to incorporate the onion, and let it cook for approximately 8 minutes, or until the potatoes and onion are browned.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Stir the mixture once or twice while it’s cooking to ensure that potatoes and onions don’t burn.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/42/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-4.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-4.jpg" height="557" id="img_eb9cedfe95" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_eb9cedfe95')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/42/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-4.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stir in the seasonings and cook the mixture again for a few minutes.</b> After the sweet potatoes and onions are lightly browned, add 5 cloves of minced garlic, 1 ½ teaspoons (4 g) of chili powder, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of paprika, and 1 teaspoon (5 g) of sea salt. Stir the mixture well, and saute it for 4 minutes.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Stir the mixture constantly as it heats to ensure that it cooks evenly.</li>
<li>You can adjust the amount of salt in the home fries to suit your taste.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-5.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-5.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-5.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-5.jpg" height="557" id="img_0146b40f1a" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0146b40f1a')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-5.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-5.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add water and cook the mixture until the potatoes are tender.</b> When the seasonings have cooked with the potato and onion mixture for a few minutes, stir 4 to 6 tablespoons (60 to 90 ml) of water into the skillet. Cover the pan with a lid, and allow the home fries to cook for 4 to 8 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked through.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Start by adding just 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of water to the skillet. If it isn’t enough, you can gradually add up to 2 more (30 ml) tablespoons.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-6.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-6.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/90/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-6.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-6.jpg" height="557" id="img_3103030c75" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3103030c75')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/90/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-6.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-6.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Transfer to a plate and serve with your favorite breakfast foods.</b> When the sweet potatoes are tender, remove the skillet from the heat. Use a slotted spoon to place the home fries on a platter or individual plates, and serve them with other breakfast foods.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>The home fries pair well with protein-rich breakfast foods, such as egg dishes, bacon, and sausage.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Creating_Sweet_Potato_Hash_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Creating_Sweet_Potato_Hash">Creating Sweet Potato Hash</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-7.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-7.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8c/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-7.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-7.jpg" height="557" id="img_6a3ff19eb7" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_6a3ff19eb7')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8c/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-7.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-7.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Boil the sweet potatoes until tender.</b> Fill a large saucepan with water, and bring it to a boil on medium-high heat. Place 2 large sweet potatoes that have been peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5-cm) cubes in the pan, and simmer them for 5 to 10 minutes or until they are tender.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Add a pinch or two of salt to the water before you bring it to boil to help season the potatoes.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-8.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-8.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-8.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-8.jpg" height="557" id="img_3fe26cf576" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3fe26cf576')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-8.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-8.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Drain the potatoes and dry completely.</b> When the sweet potatoes have finished boiling, pour them into a colander to drain them, and pat them with paper towels to dry them thoroughly. Set them aside for the moment.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-9.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-9.jpg" height="557" id="img_fcfe5cbdd9" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fcfe5cbdd9')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-9.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Heat the oil and add the onions, peppers, and garlic.</b> Add 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil to a large skillet and heat it over medium-high heat for 3 to 5 minutes. Mix in half a chopped red onion, a chopped red bell pepper, ¼ cup (115 g) of chopped green onions, and 2 cloves of chopped garlic, and saute the mixture for 5 to 6 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly golden.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You can substitute butter for the olive oil if you prefer.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-10.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-10.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-10.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-10.jpg" height="557" id="img_0ed64d1d46" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0ed64d1d46')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-10.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-10.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Season the mixture.</b> Once the vegetables are tender, add kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Next, transfer the onion mixture to a medium bowl and set aside for the moment.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-11.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-11.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d8/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-11.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-11.jpg" height="557" id="img_0b8f76b8f9" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0b8f76b8f9')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d8/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-11.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-11.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Cook the drained sweet potatoes until they’re tender.</b> Add the remaining 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of olive oil to the empty skillet. Place the drained sweet potatoes in the pan in a single layer, and cook on medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes, or until they are tender.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Stir the potatoes occasionally while they’re heating to ensure that they cook evenly.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-12.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-12.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-12.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-12.jpg" height="557" id="img_20fd9b9527" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_20fd9b9527')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-12.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-12.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Raise the heat and cook the potatoes until they’re crisp.</b> Once the sweet potatoes are tender, raise the heat to high. Allow the potatoes to cook for 2 more minutes or until they are golden brown and crisp.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Don’t stir the potatoes as they cook. That will help them crisp up on the outside.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-13.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-13.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-13.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-13.jpg" height="557" id="img_2d5c189056" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2d5c189056')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-13.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-13.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stir in the smoked paprika and onion mixture.</b> When the potatoes are crisp and golden, sprinkle 2 teaspoons (4 g) of smoked paprika over them and gently stir in the onion mixture. Mix well until the ingredients are fully blended.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you like, you can also add some chopped parsley to the hash.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-14.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-14.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-14.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-14.jpg" height="557" id="img_89ac837d5b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_89ac837d5b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-14.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-14.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Serve the hash with your favorite breakfast protein.</b> After you’ve finished mixing the sweet potato hash, remove the pan from the heat. Transfer the hash to a serving platter or individual plates, and pair with your favorite egg or meat breakfast dish.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 14" class="reference" id="_ref-14"><a href="#_note-14">[14]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Whipping_Up_Breakfast_Baked_Sweet_Potatoes_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Whipping_Up_Breakfast_Baked_Sweet_Potatoes">Whipping Up Breakfast Baked Sweet Potatoes</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Preheat the oven.</b> To ensure that the oven is hot enough to bake the sweet potatoes, it’s important to preheat it. Set the temperature to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 15" class="reference" id="_ref-15"><a href="#_note-15">[15]</a></sup><div class="mwimg tcenter floatcenter" style="max-width:190px">
<a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg"><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 15" class="whcdn" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg/v4-190px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg" height="127" id="img_b9739aeded" style="display:none" width="190"/><script>var img = document.getElementById('img_b9739aeded');
defer.add(img);
</script></a><noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 15" class="whcdn" height="127" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg/v4-190px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-15.jpg" width="190"/></noscript>
</div>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-16.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-16.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/17/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-16.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-16.jpg" height="557" id="img_0f41bbd4ed" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0f41bbd4ed')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/17/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-16.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-16.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pierce the potatoes and bake them for about an hour.</b> For the breakfast baked potatoes, you’ll need 2 large sweet potatoes. Use a fork to pierce the potatoes several times, and place them on a baking sheet. Set them in the preheated oven, and allow the potatoes to bake for 45 minutes to an hour.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 16" class="reference" id="_ref-16"><a href="#_note-16">[16]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You’ll know the sweet potatoes are done when you can easily insert the fork into them without resistance.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-17.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-17.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-17.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-17.jpg" height="557" id="img_4459e4d537" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4459e4d537')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-17.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-17.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Cut the sweet potatoes in half and allow them to cool.</b> When the potatoes are finished baking, cut each one in half with a knife. Set them on a plate and allow them to cool for about 5 minutes.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 17" class="reference" id="_ref-17"><a href="#_note-17">[17]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>The potatoes will be very hot when you remove them from the oven, so be sure to use a potholder or oven mitt to handle them as you cut.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-18.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-18.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/52/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-18.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-18.jpg" height="557" id="img_f0e56ae8cf" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f0e56ae8cf')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/52/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-18.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-18.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Separate the potato flesh from the skin and adding the toppings.</b> When the sweet potatoes are slightly cooled, run a fork between the flesh and the skin to gently separate the two. Next, divide 1 cup (245 g) of vanilla yogurt, a handful of walnuts, 2 tablespoons (20 g) of hemp seeds, and a pinch or two of cinnamon and/or nutmeg between the potatoes to top them.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 18" class="reference" id="_ref-18"><a href="#_note-18">[18]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You can also drizzle some honey or agave over the potatoes for added sweetness.</li>
<li>You can use any flavor of yogurt that you like on the potatoes and substitute your favorite type of nuts for the walnuts.</li>
<li>Feel free to customize the toppings for the baked sweet potatoes to suit your preferences. Maple syrup, almond butter, banana, and diced apple are tasty options.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-19.jpg?ajax=true&aid=8768781" href="#/Image:Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-19.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-19.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-19.jpg" height="557" id="img_61c3df1cd6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_61c3df1cd6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" height="557" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-19.jpg/aid8768781-v4-728px-Make-Breakfast-Sweet-Potatoes-Step-19.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Mix the potato and toppings together and eat.</b> To serve the potatoes, use a fork to mix the potato with the toppings. Add your favorite breakfast protein, such as eggs or bacon, to the dish, and enjoy.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 19" class="reference" id="_ref-19"><a href="#_note-19">[19]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

    "step": [
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Preparing Sweet Potato Homes Fries",
            "position": 1,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Heat the oil. Add 3 tablespoons (39 g) of coconut oil to a large non-stick skillet. Turn the heat to medium-high, and allow the oil to fully melt, which should take approximately 3 minutes.[1]\nYou can also use a cast iron skillet to make the home fries.\nIf you prefer, you can substitute butter or olive oil for the coconut oil."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Cook the sweet potatoes for a few minutes. Once the coconut oil is heated, add 1 \u00bd pounds (675 g) of sweet potatoes that have been chopped into \u00bd-inch (13-mm) cubes to the skillet. Allow the potatoes to cook for 4 minutes.[2]\nWhen you add the potatoes to the skillet, stir them in the oil so they are fully coated. Leave them to cook undisturbed after that, though."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Mix in the onion and cook the mixture for several minutes. When the sweet potatoes have cooked for a few minutes, mix in 1 large, sliced yellow onion. Stir the mixture well to incorporate the onion, and let it cook for approximately 8 minutes, or until the potatoes and onion are browned.[3]\nStir the mixture once or twice while it\u2019s cooking to ensure that potatoes and onions don\u2019t burn."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stir in the seasonings and cook the mixture again for a few minutes. After the sweet potatoes and onions are lightly browned, add 5 cloves of minced garlic, 1 \u00bd teaspoons (4 g) of chili powder, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of paprika, and 1 teaspoon (5 g) of sea salt. Stir the mixture well, and saute it for 4 minutes.[4]\nStir the mixture constantly as it heats to ensure that it cooks evenly.\nYou can adjust the amount of salt in the home fries to suit your taste."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add water and cook the mixture until the potatoes are tender. When the seasonings have cooked with the potato and onion mixture for a few minutes, stir 4 to 6 tablespoons (60 to 90 ml) of water into the skillet. Cover the pan with a lid, and allow the home fries to cook for 4 to 8 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked through.[5]\nStart by adding just 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of water to the skillet. If it isn\u2019t enough, you can gradually add up to 2 more (30 ml) tablespoons."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Transfer to a plate and serve with your favorite breakfast foods. When the sweet potatoes are tender, remove the skillet from the heat. Use a slotted spoon to place the home fries on a platter or individual plates, and serve them with other breakfast foods.[6]\nThe home fries pair well with protein-rich breakfast foods, such as egg dishes, bacon, and sausage."
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Creating Sweet Potato Hash",
            "position": 2,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Boil the sweet potatoes until tender. Fill a large saucepan with water, and bring it to a boil on medium-high heat. Place 2 large sweet potatoes that have been peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5-cm) cubes in the pan, and simmer them for 5 to 10 minutes or until they are tender.[7]\nAdd a pinch or two of salt to the water before you bring it to boil to help season the potatoes."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Drain the potatoes and dry completely. When the sweet potatoes have finished boiling, pour them into a colander to drain them, and pat them with paper towels to dry them thoroughly. Set them aside for the moment.[8]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Heat the oil and add the onions, peppers, and garlic. Add 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil to a large skillet and heat it over medium-high heat for 3 to 5 minutes. Mix in half a chopped red onion, a chopped red bell pepper, \u00bc cup (115 g) of chopped green onions, and 2 cloves of chopped garlic, and saute the mixture for 5 to 6 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly golden.[9]\nYou can substitute butter for the olive oil if you prefer."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Season the mixture. Once the vegetables are tender, add kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Next, transfer the onion mixture to a medium bowl and set aside for the moment.[10]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Cook the drained sweet potatoes until they\u2019re tender. Add the remaining 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of olive oil to the empty skillet. Place the drained sweet potatoes in the pan in a single layer, and cook on medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes, or until they are tender.[11]\nStir the potatoes occasionally while they\u2019re heating to ensure that they cook evenly."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Raise the heat and cook the potatoes until they\u2019re crisp. Once the sweet potatoes are tender, raise the heat to high. Allow the potatoes to cook for 2 more minutes or until they are golden brown and crisp.[12]\nDon\u2019t stir the potatoes as they cook. That will help them crisp up on the outside."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 7,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stir in the smoked paprika and onion mixture. When the potatoes are crisp and golden, sprinkle 2 teaspoons (4 g) of smoked paprika over them and gently stir in the onion mixture. Mix well until the ingredients are fully blended.[13]\nIf you like, you can also add some chopped parsley to the hash."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 8,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Serve the hash with your favorite breakfast protein. After you\u2019ve finished mixing the sweet potato hash, remove the pan from the heat. Transfer the hash to a serving platter or individual plates, and pair with your favorite egg or meat breakfast dish.[14]"
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Whipping Up Breakfast Baked Sweet Potatoes",
            "position": 3,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Preheat the oven. To ensure that the oven is hot enough to bake the sweet potatoes, it\u2019s important to preheat it. Set the temperature to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully.[15]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Pierce the potatoes and bake them for about an hour. For the breakfast baked potatoes, you\u2019ll need 2 large sweet potatoes. Use a fork to pierce the potatoes several times, and place them on a baking sheet. Set them in the preheated oven, and allow the potatoes to bake for 45 minutes to an hour.[16]\nYou\u2019ll know the sweet potatoes are done when you can easily insert the fork into them without resistance."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Cut the sweet potatoes in half and allow them to cool. When the potatoes are finished baking, cut each one in half with a knife. Set them on a plate and allow them to cool for about 5 minutes.[17]\nThe potatoes will be very hot when you remove them from the oven, so be sure to use a potholder or oven mitt to handle them as you cut."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Separate the potato flesh from the skin and adding the toppings. When the sweet potatoes are slightly cooled, run a fork between the flesh and the skin to gently separate the two. Next, divide 1 cup (245 g) of vanilla yogurt, a handful of walnuts, 2 tablespoons (20 g) of hemp seeds, and a pinch or two of cinnamon and\/or nutmeg between the potatoes to top them.[18]\nYou can also drizzle some honey or agave over the potatoes for added sweetness.\nYou can use any flavor of yogurt that you like on the potatoes and substitute your favorite type of nuts for the walnuts.\nFeel free to customize the toppings for the baked sweet potatoes to suit your preferences. Maple syrup, almond butter, banana, and diced apple are tasty options."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Mix the potato and toppings together and eat. To serve the potatoes, use a fork to mix the potato with the toppings. Add your favorite breakfast protein, such as eggs or bacon, to the dish, and enjoy.[19]"
                    }
                }
            ]
        }
    ],
    "description": "How to Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes. Sweet potatoes make a tasty side dish for a wide variety of meals. If you're only incorporating them for lunch and dinner, though, you're missing out. Whether you prefer eggs, sausage, or bacon, sweet..."

title: How to Make Breakfast Sweet Potatoes
content_html:
Heat the oil. Add 3 tablespoons (39 g) of coconut oil to a large non-stick skillet. Turn the heat to medium-high, and allow the oil to fully melt, which should take approximately 3 minutes.[1]
  • You can also use a cast iron skillet to make the home fries.
  • If you prefer, you can substitute butter or olive oil for the coconut oil.
Cook the sweet potatoes for a few minutes. Once the coconut oil is heated, add 1 ½ pounds (675 g) of sweet potatoes that have been chopped into ½-inch (13-mm) cubes to the skillet. Allow the potatoes to cook for 4 minutes.[2]
  • When you add the potatoes to the skillet, stir them in the oil so they are fully coated. Leave them to cook undisturbed after that, though.
Mix in the onion and cook the mixture for several minutes. When the sweet potatoes have cooked for a few minutes, mix in 1 large, sliced yellow onion. Stir the mixture well to incorporate the onion, and let it cook for approximately 8 minutes, or until the potatoes and onion are browned.[3]
  • Stir the mixture once or twice while it’s cooking to ensure that potatoes and onions don’t burn.
Stir in the seasonings and cook the mixture again for a few minutes. After the sweet potatoes and onions are lightly browned, add 5 cloves of minced garlic, 1 ½ teaspoons (4 g) of chili powder, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of paprika, and 1 teaspoon (5 g) of sea salt. Stir the mixture well, and saute it for 4 minutes.[4]
  • Stir the mixture constantly as it heats to ensure that it cooks evenly.
  • You can adjust the amount of salt in the home fries to suit your taste.
Add water and cook the mixture until the potatoes are tender. When the seasonings have cooked with the potato and onion mixture for a few minutes, stir 4 to 6 tablespoons (60 to 90 ml) of water into the skillet. Cover the pan with a lid, and allow the home fries to cook for 4 to 8 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked through.[5]
  • Start by adding just 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of water to the skillet. If it isn’t enough, you can gradually add up to 2 more (30 ml) tablespoons.
Transfer to a plate and serve with your favorite breakfast foods. When the sweet potatoes are tender, remove the skillet from the heat. Use a slotted spoon to place the home fries on a platter or individual plates, and serve them with other breakfast foods.[6]
  • The home fries pair well with protein-rich breakfast foods, such as egg dishes, bacon, and sausage.
Boil the sweet potatoes until tender. Fill a large saucepan with water, and bring it to a boil on medium-high heat. Place 2 large sweet potatoes that have been peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5-cm) cubes in the pan, and simmer them for 5 to 10 minutes or until they are tender.[7]
  • Add a pinch or two of salt to the water before you bring it to boil to help season the potatoes.
Drain the potatoes and dry completely. When the sweet potatoes have finished boiling, pour them into a colander to drain them, and pat them with paper towels to dry them thoroughly. Set them aside for the moment.[8]
Heat the oil and add the onions, peppers, and garlic. Add 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil to a large skillet and heat it over medium-high heat for 3 to 5 minutes. Mix in half a chopped red onion, a chopped red bell pepper, ¼ cup (115 g) of chopped green onions, and 2 cloves of chopped garlic, and saute the mixture for 5 to 6 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly golden.[9]
  • You can substitute butter for the olive oil if you prefer.
Season the mixture. Once the vegetables are tender, add kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Next, transfer the onion mixture to a medium bowl and set aside for the moment.[10]
Cook the drained sweet potatoes until they’re tender. Add the remaining 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of olive oil to the empty skillet. Place the drained sweet potatoes in the pan in a single layer, and cook on medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes, or until they are tender.[11]
  • Stir the potatoes occasionally while they’re heating to ensure that they cook evenly.
Raise the heat and cook the potatoes until they’re crisp. Once the sweet potatoes are tender, raise the heat to high. Allow the potatoes to cook for 2 more minutes or until they are golden brown and crisp.[12]
  • Don’t stir the potatoes as they cook. That will help them crisp up on the outside.
Stir in the smoked paprika and onion mixture. When the potatoes are crisp and golden, sprinkle 2 teaspoons (4 g) of smoked paprika over them and gently stir in the onion mixture. Mix well until the ingredients are fully blended.[13]
  • If you like, you can also add some chopped parsley to the hash.
Serve the hash with your favorite breakfast protein. After you’ve finished mixing the sweet potato hash, remove the pan from the heat. Transfer the hash to a serving platter or individual plates, and pair with your favorite egg or meat breakfast dish.[14]
Preheat the oven. To ensure that the oven is hot enough to bake the sweet potatoes, it’s important to preheat it. Set the temperature to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius), and allow it to heat fully.[15]
Pierce the potatoes and bake them for about an hour. For the breakfast baked potatoes, you’ll need 2 large sweet potatoes. Use a fork to pierce the potatoes several times, and place them on a baking sheet. Set them in the preheated oven, and allow the potatoes to bake for 45 minutes to an hour.[16]
  • You’ll know the sweet potatoes are done when you can easily insert the fork into them without resistance.
Cut the sweet potatoes in half and allow them to cool. When the potatoes are finished baking, cut each one in half with a knife. Set them on a plate and allow them to cool for about 5 minutes.[17]
  • The potatoes will be very hot when you remove them from the oven, so be sure to use a potholder or oven mitt to handle them as you cut.
Separate the potato flesh from the skin and adding the toppings. When the sweet potatoes are slightly cooled, run a fork between the flesh and the skin to gently separate the two. Next, divide 1 cup (245 g) of vanilla yogurt, a handful of walnuts, 2 tablespoons (20 g) of hemp seeds, and a pinch or two of cinnamon and/or nutmeg between the potatoes to top them.[18]
  • You can also drizzle some honey or agave over the potatoes for added sweetness.
  • You can use any flavor of yogurt that you like on the potatoes and substitute your favorite type of nuts for the walnuts.
  • Feel free to customize the toppings for the baked sweet potatoes to suit your preferences. Maple syrup, almond butter, banana, and diced apple are tasty options.
Mix the potato and toppings together and eat. To serve the potatoes, use a fork to mix the potato with the toppings. Add your favorite breakfast protein, such as eggs or bacon, to the dish, and enjoy.[19]
